column4: Anyone know how to run a force-check for disk errors in Ubuntu Dapper?
when i type dosfsck -a -r /dev/hda5 (for any drive) i get this error
Yes. All the partitions are giving this msg
Did you run e2fsck on the drive by mistake?
No. I ran man e2fsckand checked was for ext03 so ran dosfsck then
XP is there on 2nd hdd primary part and boots fine. The prob is ubuntu Every time says error and boots on startup
While windows doesnt give any error in same parts
and Ubuntu takes about 15min on startup eachtime to check
The Ubuntu errors are on the FAT partitions? Have you tried running the Windows scandisk tool or whatever they have nowadays?
Yep. They're in FAT32. Tried almost every tool. Noone gives any error
An easy way out is to not have Ubuntu check your DOS partitions on boot, since Windows will scan those partitions. There's nothing really wrong with those partitions anyhow
Ok, Cool. How do I then make Ubuntu not check disks on boot?
Can i pvt msg you the entries in the file?
